DialogueOption.Text: Is there anything I should do before I take off?
Um, where are the hatchlings again, if I wanted to say goodbye?
Is there anything I should do before I take off?
Um, where are the hatchlings again, if I wanted to say goodbye?
Uh, I think I need to clear my head.. Should I do anything else before I take off again?
Um, where are the hatchlings again, if I wanted to say goodbye?
Uh, hang on. Is there anything else I should do before I take off?
Um, where are the hatchlings again, if I wanted to say goodbye?
Hey Slate, I'm a time traveler now. Got any questions for me before I take off?
Um, where are the hatchlings again, if I wanted to say goodbye?

Dialogue.Page: Oh sure, if you're in no rush.
Go talk to the little hatchlings around the village before you go, will ya?

The young hatchlings always get excited about space, every time a new space cadet leaves the village to go into space. Just humor them and answer whatever questions they have about space best you can.
It's just good for the space program's image. Someday, these little hatchlings might join the space program themself, y'know?
Also, this ain't my business, but if you leave without a word, they'll probably hold a lifelong grudge against the astronaut that didn't say bye to them. No pressure.

DialogueOption.Text: Alright, alright, I'll go talk to the little gills before I go.

Dialogue.Page: Again? Sheesh, you're still half-asleep, aren't you?
Hey, go talk to the little hatchlings around the village while you clear your head. I don't want you near the ship while you're still dazed.

The young hatchlings always get excited about space every time a new space cadet leaves the village to go into space. Just humor them and answer whatever questions they have about space.. er, as best as you can.
It's just good for the space program's image. Someday, these little hatchlings might join the space program themself, y'know?
Also, this ain't my business, but if you leave without a word, they'll probably hold a lifelong grudge against the astronaut that didn't say bye to them. No pressure.

DialogueOption.Text: Alright, alright, I'll go talk to the little gills before I go.

DialogueNode.Name: Slate_SW3
DialogueNode.Dialogue:
Hey Slate, I'm a time traveler now. Got any questions for me before I take off? Yeah, just one. Did you bang your head tossing and turning?
Go talk to the little hatchlings around the village before you go, will ya? The young hatchlings always get excited about space, every time a new space cadet leaves the village to go into space. Just humor them and answer whatever questions they have about space best you can. It's just good for the space program's image. Someday, these little hatchlings might join the space program themself, y'know? Also, this ain't my business, but if you leave without a word, they'll probably hold a lifelong grudge against the astronaut that didn't say bye to them. No pressure.

DialogueOption.Text: Alright, alright, I'll go talk to the little gills before I go.

Dialogue.Page: Cool. Just remember: there's Mica, Tephra, Galena, Arkose, and Moraine.
If you forget to say goodbye to any one of them, they'll probably never forget it as long as they live.
Uh, how'd I know? I'm just roasting marshmallows here.
Mica's probably still fiddling with the model rocket, just up the hill.
Tephra and Galena should be playing in the village somewhere.
I saw those two trekking outside the village recently for whatever reason, though - so don't take my word on that.
Arkose's probably still throwing rocks into the patch of ghost matter at the top of the village.
Still uh.. no idea why they do that all day.
And Moraine's probably stargazing on that big tree in the village, making sure Marl doesn't chop it down.
I wonder if that Marl'll ever let go of that grudge.. <Pause> No good comes outta holding a grudge against a tree, you know?
That's all I know. Just get a move on - you'll probably just find all of 'em on the way up to the observatory for those launch codes, anyway.
